title: How to Calculate the Diameter of a Circle

steps.title: If you know the radius of the circle, double it to get the diameter.
steps.content: If you know the radius of the circle, double it to get the diameter. The radius is the distance from the center of the circle to its edge. [1] X Research source

steps.title: If you know the circumference of the circle, divide it by π to get the diameter.
steps.content: If you know the circumference of the circle, divide it by π to get the diameter. π is equal to approximately 3.14 but you should use your calculator to get the most accurate results. [2] X Research source

steps.title: If you know the area of the circle, divide the result by π and find its square root to get the radius; then multiply by 2 to get the diameter.
steps.content: If you know the area of the circle, divide the result by π and find its square root to get the radius; then multiply by 2 to get the diameter. This goes back to manipulating the formula for finding the area of a circle, A = πr 2 , to get the diameter. You can transform this into r = √(A/π) cm. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Draw a horizontal line inside the circle from one edge to the other.
steps.content: Draw a horizontal line inside the circle from one edge to the other. Use a ruler or a straight edge to do this. It can be at the top, near the bottom, or anywhere in between.

steps.title: Label the points where the line crosses the circle points "A" and "B."
steps.content: Label the points where the line crosses the circle points "A" and "B."

steps.title: Draw two overlapping circles, one using A as the center and the other using B as the center.
steps.content: Draw two overlapping circles, one using A as the center and the other using B as the center. Be sure the two circles overlap like a Venn diagram . [4] X Research source

steps.title: Draw a vertical line through the two points at which the outer circles intersect.
steps.content: Draw a vertical line through the two points at which the outer circles intersect. This line marks the diameter of the circle. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Measure the diameter.
steps.content: Measure the diameter. Measure it using a ruler, or for greater accuracy, a pair of digital calipers . You're done!
